title: Weird thing about Hecarim
body:
Why does {{champion:120}} have a damage reduction against monsters when using his Rampage (Q)? Like, as far as I know only Garen has something like that on his E. Hecarim's a jungler and while, in my experience, he's not bad, little things like that hinder him. 

A farm jungler who has restrictions on his farming, like, why?

replies.body:
He was released in Season 2 when the jungle was super easy to clear. They had to stop him from potentially becoming Shyvana with CC. 

I think they should evaluate it again now. It might be good to have it at 100%.

They seem to be looking at him with the little PBE buffs he's getting. Tiny things, like reduced mana cost on his Rampage and a higher healing cap. 

So, come 5.1, he could have it removed. Maybe.
Because over time Riot has continuously nerfed Hecarim so much that the phrase 'beating a dead horse' literally fucking applies here.

To keep him from clearing the jungle so fast you hardly realize he's there until he's ganking mid and a level ahead.
Truthfully though, with the jungle changes, I think there's reason to lighten or remove the limits on his abilities where jungle monsters are concerned.

Tbh, there are a lot of things wrong with hecarim atm. It's not because he's bad, its because there are so many better picks. 

Best example is Rek which is a hecarim that's better in almost every aspect.
It makes his clear quite slow, especially early on,  with the low damage from rank 1 rampage.
It is irritating, wish they would revert as the original reason for why they did that no longer applies here in this season.

I think the worst part of this is just the tooltip: reduced damage against minions and monsters sounds bad, but 50% increased damage against champions sounds really nice, even if there's zero difference in the actual numbers. While Hec may just as well deal full damage to jungle monsters now, just a switch in the tooltip would make his Q feel better.
Maybe they don't want him to be a jungler and so gave him the Alistar treatment (stick to support or else!).

I thought about making a thread about this same subject. It's like they WANT Hecarim to be bad in the new jungle... smh

A small damage reduction (80%) wouldn't be bad, but having your damage taken down by a third? Uhh, no.
The same reason he has that awkward Rampage stacking thing.
